title: Preserve raw body on fetch parse errors
Web Dashboard: Skill execution + learn mode
[P0] Fix URL Encoding Bug in SkillRunner
description: Inconsistent URL encoding between build_url() function and SkillRequest.build_url() method in runner.py will cause failures when scaling to 150+ skills. Must unify to single function with consistent urllib.parse.quote() encoding. Test with special chars: spaces, unicode, &, =, #
close_reason: Unified URL encoding: SkillRequest.build_url() now uses urllib.parse.quote() consistent with runner.py's build_url(). Added 5 encoding tests.

title: Implement scroll step with 'until' condition
description: Scroll support for infinite scroll pages. Options: to (bottom/top/selector/pixels), until (condition/selector), max_iterations. Handles lazy-loaded lists, virtualized content.

title: Transport Parity Suite (CI-safe tests)
description: Test suite ensuring all transports enforce the same security policy. Tests: private IP blocking, DNS rebinding, redirect host lock, response size cap, header redaction. CI-safe (no real network).

title: Design steps-based Recipe DSL (Oracle-enhanced)
description: Flexible recipe format where each recipe is an ordered list of steps. Core step types: navigate, wait_for, wait_for_response, click, fill, scroll, extract, fetch (browser context), evaluate_js, parse, switch_frame, switch_tab, download, repeat, if. Per-step fields: timeout_ms, retry policy, on_error. Key insight: fetch in browser context auto-includes cookies. evaluate_js is escape hatch for edge cases.

title: ALT-A: Improve LLM analyzer reliability
description: Improve auto-learning: 1) Simplify output format (URL+method only), 2) Add regex fallback, 3) Validate LLM output, 4) Add confidence score. Effort: 2-3 days. Risk: Still LLM-dependent.
close_reason: Not chosen - pivoting to curated catalog (ALT-B)

title: Epic: Steps-based Recipe DSL Implementation
description: Implement Oracle-enhanced recipe format. Core primitives: navigate, wait_for, wait_for_response, click, fill, scroll, extract, fetch (browser context), evaluate_js, parse, switch_frame, switch_tab, download, repeat, if. Per-step resilience. ~90% site coverage target.

title: SkillAuth model for API-key recipes
description: Support recipes that require API keys. Secure storage (not in YAML). Injection at execution time.

title: Enforce auth_token on skills HTTP endpoints
Replace bs4 with selectolax
description: Replace bs4 usage with selectolax (or remove dependency entirely). Reserve bs4 only if absolutely necessary and benchmarked. Standardize JSON parsing on orjson in runner + verifier.

title: Error envelope standardization
description: All tools + REST return: {ok, data, meta, error}. ErrorDetail: error_code, message, retryable, stage, reason_codes, task_id, retry_after_sec. ResponseMeta: transport_used, timings_ms, cache_hit, redirect_hops, fingerprint_match, session_id.

title: Create 10 starter recipes for developer tools
description: Curate and test recipes for: npm-package-search, npm-package-info, pypi-package-search, pypi-package-info, github-repo-search, github-repo-info, dockerhub-image-search, hackernews-search, reddit-subreddit-posts, coingecko-price

title: Add recipe_search MCP tool for discovery
description: Add MCP tool: recipe_search(query) -> list of matching recipes from catalog. Searches by name, description, tags, category.

title: Storage hardening: atomic YAML writes
description: Atomic YAML writes using temp + fsync + os.replace. Prevents partial writes.

title: Epic: Phase 1.2 - Runner + Policy Parity Hardening
description: Make direct execution fast, consistent across transports, and security-invariant. Shared EgressPolicy, transport parity testing, pooled clients, perf benchmarks.

title: Deprecation policy + docs
description: Document deprecation policy (remove only in minor/major). Update CLI docs to match current state.

title: Epic: Phase 1.5 - Learning Corpus + Offline Evaluation
description: Make auto-learning success rate measurable. Corpus of sanitized recordings + expected outputs. Offline eval CLI. CI gate for regressions.

title: Add per-step resilience fields (timeout, retry, on_error)
description: Every step can have: timeout_ms, retry: { max, backoff }, on_error: fail|continue|branch. Makes recipes not flaky. Per-step instead of separate retry step type.

title: Implement recipe quality state machine
description: Explicit data-driven transitions. draft: validation passed once. verified: N successes + Jaccard >= 0.85. deprecated: M failures or fingerprint drift. Self-healing. SQLite storage.

title: ALT-B: Pivot to curated recipe catalog
description: Ship 50-100 pre-built recipes. Users contribute via YAML. Keep direct execution (works!). Deprecate auto-learning. Effort: 1 week. Risk: Low, predictable.

title: Upgrade recorder contract
description: Recorder MUST capture: initiator page URL, resource type, content-type/status/byte-length, JSON key sample (200 chars), timing. MUST NOT capture: full HTML, >32KB response body, raw binary.

title: Implement tab management (new_tab/switch_tab/close_tab)
description: Multi-tab flow support. SSO flows, detail pages opening in new tab. new_tab: url, switch_tab: index|url_match, close_tab: current|index, wait_for_popup.

title: Install safety hooks (git guard + .claude settings)
description: Add repo-level git safety guard + Claude hooks wiring (.claude/settings.json). Sync global guard, validate via tests and just check.

title: Implement signals module (recipes/signals.py)
description: Pure functions. Turns raw recordings into per-request features and safe summaries for candidate ranking. Extracts: URL, method, status, content-type, response size, structural summary, timing, initiator page URL, resource type. Sanitizes before passing to ranker/analyzer.

title: Tool surface stabilization
description: Replace recipe_run_direct with recipe_run(strategy=auto|direct|hint). Add recipe_learn, run (single entry-point), recipe_create_from_candidate, recipe_validate, recipe_explain, recipe_dry_run. run_browser_agent becomes alias/deprecated.

title: Implement extraction assist (recipes/extraction_assist.py)
description: Programmatic JMESPath candidate generation from JSON structure. Given a JSON response, generates candidate extract_path expressions by analyzing structure (arrays, nested objects, common key patterns). Presents to LLM for selection rather than invention.

title: Add debug artifacts (screenshot, snapshot) on failure
description: When recipe fails, capture evidence: screenshot, HTML dump, cookies. Reduces debugging time. Can be automatic on_error or explicit step.

title: SSRF TOCTOU vulnerability via DNS rebinding in skills/runner.py
close_reason: Fixed in commits f3eeb19, faa3f10, e6cc929, 805ecd6

title: ALT-C: Simplify to navigation hints only
description: Remove direct execution, keep only navigation hints. Agent runs full browser-use with guidance. Effort: Low (deletion). Risk: Loses 50x speedup.
close_reason: Not chosen - pivoting to curated catalog (ALT-B)

title: Avoid blocking SkillStore I/O in async handlers
Declare BeautifulSoup dependency for HTML extraction
Implement download step for file exports
description: Trigger download and capture file. Many export flows return CSV/PDF/Excel, not HTML. Syntax: download: { trigger: click|url, selector: '#export-btn', save_as: filename }

title: Implement frame switching (switch_frame/within_frame)
description: Switch context to iframe by selector or URL match. Required for auth widgets, payment forms, embedded content. Syntax: switch_frame: '#payment-iframe' or switch_frame: { url_match: '*stripe*' }

title: Epic: Phase 4 - Polish and Release
description: PyPI publication, CI pipeline, documentation, server module split. Final quality gates.

title: Recipe analyzer ignores user-requested parameters (limit, page) from task description
description:
When learning a recipe, user-requested parameters (like limit, page number) should be extracted as recipe parameters.

**User request:**
'learn skill to extract a page of current user's stars from github, it takes limit and page number'

**Expected behavior:**
Recipe should have parameters:
- username (from URL path)  
- limit/per_page (user requested)
- page (user requested)

And URL template: https://api.github.com/users/{username}/starred?per_page={limit}&page={page}

**Actual behavior:**
Recipe only has username parameter. The user-requested limit and page parameters were ignored.

**Root cause:**
The analyzer focuses on what was captured in network traffic but doesn't consider user intent from the task description. When user says 'it takes limit and page number', those should become recipe parameters.

**Fix approach:**
1. Enhance analyzer to extract parameter hints from task description
2. Parse phrases like 'takes X and Y', 'with X parameter', 'accepts X'
3. Map common terms: limit->per_page, count->per_page, page->page

**Files:**
- src/mcp_server_browser_use/recipes/analyzer.py
- src/mcp_server_browser_use/recipes/prompts.py
close_reason: Fixed - prompts now instruct LLM to extract user-requested parameters from task description

title: Storage hardening: async store I/O
description: Async store I/O using anyio.to_thread.run_sync. Prevents blocking async event loop.

title: Define corpus format + create initial entries
description: recipes/corpus/ with manifest.yaml, per-site dirs containing: recording.json, candidates.json, expected_draft.json, expected_fingerprint.json, response_stub.json, metadata.yaml. Create 3-5 initial entries (github-repo-search, npm-package-search, etc.).

title: Implement minimizer (recipes/minimizer.py)
description: Single-pass header/query elimination + volatility detection. Bounded attempts. Tests each header/query param for necessity. Detects volatile params (timestamps, nonces). Produces minimal recipe.

title: Implement recipes warmup + bench --ci
description: CLI: recipes warmup (precompile verified recipes, print cache stats). bench --ci (perf harness against local deterministic test server). Wire perf gate.

title: Implement learning artifacts persistence
description: Persist learning artifact per attempt. Contents: recorded calls, candidate ranking, LLM prompt (redacted), LLM output, validation attempts, final recipe. Disk caps + configurable retention.

title: README + usage docs
description: README with usage examples, Claude Desktop config, connection methods, recipe system explanation.

title: Add fetch context: browser vs http
description: Oracle key insight: fetch in browser context auto-includes cookies. Add context field: browser (default, uses CDP fetch with cookies) vs http (external client). Browser context solves cookie parity issues.

title: Server module split
description: Split server.py (~1825 lines) into: server/mcp_tools.py, server/rest_api.py, server/sse.py, server/dashboard.py. Keep server.py as thin composition root.

title: Implement wait_for_response step (network capture)
description: Wait for XHR/fetch matching predicate (URL glob, method, status), capture response body/headers into variables. Cleaner than DOM scraping when data is on the wire. Syntax: wait_for_response: { url_match: '**/api/data*', save_as: response }

title: Better pagination parameter handling
description: Detect and parameterize page/offset/limit/cursor params. Currently pagination params may be hardcoded.

title: Create bundled recipes package structure
description: Create src/mcp_server_browser_use/recipes/library/ for shipped recipes. Add __init__.py with SkillLibrary class that reads YAML from package resources.

title: Per-IP rate limiting
description: Token bucket per IP. Defaults: MCP 60/min (burst 10), REST 120/min (burst 20), recipe exec 30/min (burst 5). Response: 429 + Retry-After + RATE_LIMITED error_code. In-memory dict.

title: Artifact schema_hash + resume fail-fast
description: Add schema_hash to all artifact models. On pipeline resume, check schema_hash matches current code. Fail fast with clear error if schema changed (forces re-run from that stage).

title: Contract tests in CI
description: MCP tool schemas pinned + contract tests. Ensure tool inputs/outputs match declared schemas. Run on every PR. Gate 2 pre-merge requirement.

title: Implement heuristic analyzer (recipes/heuristic_analyzer.py)
description: Pure functions. Handles simple GET/JSON recipe drafts without LLM. When top candidate is a clear winner (high score delta from #2), skip LLM entirely and generate recipe draft deterministically.

title: Implement header source discovery in learning mode
description: During learning: 1) Capture which headers the 'money request' needs, 2) For each header, discover its SOURCE (which cookie? which meta tag? which JS variable?), 3) Store the extraction method (e.g., 'csrf-token comes from meta[name=csrf-token]'), NOT the actual value. This makes recipes work with fresh sessions.

title: Implement recipe execution with live header extraction
description: Recipe execution flow: 1) Navigate to setup URL (establishes session), 2) Extract each required header from its source (read cookie, query DOM, eval JS), 3) Build request with fresh headers, 4) Execute fetch via CDP, 5) Parse response. Agent follows recipe instructions exactly - no exploration.

title: Implement eval CLI command
description: mcp-server-browser-use eval --corpus recipes/corpus --ci. Runs pipeline deterministically. Supports --no-network mode with ResponseStubs. Reports success rate, failure reasons, regression diffs by stage.

title: [P0] Add Response Size Cap to SkillRunner
description: Add MAX_RESPONSE_SIZE = 1_000_000 (1MB) constant and truncate response in JS fetch before returning to Python. Prevents OOM on huge API responses when running 150+ skills in batch.
close_reason: Added MAX_RESPONSE_SIZE=1MB constant, JS truncation in _build_fetch_js, truncation logging. Prevents OOM on huge API responses.

title: Security headers for dashboard
description: CSP (default-src self, no inline scripts), X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff, X-Frame-Options: DENY, Cache-Control: no-store. HTML-escape all task outputs. Disable dashboard on non-loopback unless explicitly enabled. Origin/Host validation for CSRF.

title: Implement validator with closed-loop validation (recipes/validator.py)
description: Schema + safety canonicalization + closed-loop validation. Execute recipe in same browser context immediately after analysis. Require: 2xx + response_type parse success. On failure: try next candidate OR second LLM pass. Only persist if validation passes. Requires run_raw() on RecipeRunner. URL canonicalization, reject credentials-in-URL.

title: DECISION: Recipes as procedural knowledge (not cached API calls)
description: Igor's vision: Recipes store HOW to get data, not cached headers. Learning captures: 1) What page to visit, 2) WHERE headers come from (meta tag, cookie, JS var), 3) The endpoint pattern, 4) How to parse response. Execution: Agent reads recipe, navigates, extracts LIVE headers, executes. No stale data.
close_reason: Decision made - proceeding with procedural knowledge approach

title: Deterministic local test server
description: Local test server for CI-safe benchmarks. Feeds Gate 2a + Gate 2c. Deterministic responses for reproducible perf testing.

title: Implement evaluate_js step (escape hatch)
description: Oracle #1 priority. Run JS in page context via CDP Runtime.evaluate, return value to recipe variables. Use cases: framework state (window.__NEXT_DATA__), computed tokens, decoding values. Syntax: evaluate_js: 'return window.API_KEY' with save_as field.

title: Plan: add EV decision tree + v1 strategy ADR
description: Context: PLAN_TO_SHIP_MCP_BROWSER_USE.md. Add ADR-6 EV decision tree, v1 strategy lock (lean hybrid), premortem, YAML frontmatter. Acceptance: just check passes, commit+push.

title: ALT-D: Abandon recipes entirely
description: Delete ~2000 LOC. Focus on core browser-use wrapper. Add result-level caching instead. Effort: Low. Risk: Loses differentiation.
close_reason: Not chosen - pivoting to curated catalog (ALT-B)

title: Implement candidate ranker (recipes/candidates.py)
description: Pure functions + unit tests, no LLM calls. Weighted heuristic scoring (~15 features): URL/query similarity to task, response body overlap, content-type preference (JSON>HTML>text), list likelihood, JSON richness, status preference, API path hints, tracker/telemetry penalties, body size penalties, cache-buster penalties, timing bonus, same-host soft bonus. Returns top_k ranked candidates. Build FIRST per Oracle R1.

title: Add JSON XSSI prefix stripping in parse step
description: Many APIs return JSON with safety prefixes like 'for(;;);' or ')]}'. Add strip_prefix option to parse step. Syntax: parse: { type: json, strip_prefix: ["for(;;);", ")]}'"] }

title: CI gate for corpus regressions
description: Soft gate initially: no regressions in corpus success rate unless baseline updated intentionally. Hard gate before v1. Runs in GitHub Actions.

title: PyPI package publication
description: Publish mcp-server-browser-use to PyPI. Proper metadata, classifiers, entry points.

title: Implement shared EgressPolicy module
description: Single EgressPolicy enforced in all transports (httpx_public, in_page_fetch) + agent navigation. URL validation, private IP blocking, DNS rebinding checks. Shared module prevents divergence.

title: Rewrite analyzer prompts for top-K candidates
description: LLM receives ONLY top K candidates (not raw recording). Each candidate includes: URL, method, status, content-type, response size, structural summary. LLM output MUST include chosen_candidate_id. Extraction assist presents programmatically computed candidate JMESPaths for LLM to select. extract_path optional for v1.

title: Implement artifacts store (recipes/artifacts/store.py)
description: Atomic write/read for pipeline artifacts. schema_hash checks for resume. Permission enforcement (0700 dirs, 0600 files). Non-following opens. Per-task artifact directories.

title: SQL injection risk via f-string in observability/store.py
close_reason: Fixed in commits f3eeb19, faa3f10, e6cc929, 805ecd6

title: Recorder cleanup failures cause memory leaks in server.py
close_reason: Fixed in commits f3eeb19, faa3f10, e6cc929, 805ecd6

title: [Phase 6] Documentation & Polish
description: Update README with skills library section. Create SKILLS.md with full catalog. Add skill contribution guide (CONTRIBUTING.md). Document auth requirements per service. Add troubleshooting guide for common issues.

title: [Phase 6] CI/CD for Skills
description: Add skill health check workflow (weekly). Add skill verification in PR checks. Add skill count badge to README. Create automated fixture update workflow.

title: Extract skill_run tool from run_browser_agent
description:
Create a dedicated `skill_run` MCP tool for direct skill execution:

```python
@server.tool()
async def skill_run(
    skill_name: str,
    params: dict[str, Any] | None = None,
) -> str:
    """Execute a skill directly via CDP fetch (no agent, no LLM calls).
    
    Fast execution for verified skills. Fails if:
    - Skill doesn't exist
    - Skill doesn't support direct execution  
    - Auth is required (returns error instead of fallback)
    """
```

Benefits:
- Zero LLM cost for skill execution
- Predictable execution path
- Clear separation from agent behavior
- No implicit fallback confusion

Currently embedded in run_browser_agent lines 220-280.

title: E2E recipe learning test script
close_reason: E2E recipe learning tests implemented (10 pass, 3 skip)

title: Build header source mapper (cookie/meta/JS detection)
description: Given a header name and value seen in a request, determine its SOURCE: 1) Check if value matches any cookie, 2) Check if value appears in page meta tags, 3) Check if value is in window/localStorage, 4) Check if value was set by previous response headers. Return extraction instruction like 'cookie:li_at' or 'meta[name=csrf-token]'.

title: Deprecate auto-learning as default, make experimental
description: 1) Update learn=True documentation to say 'experimental', 2) Add warning message when learn=True used, 3) Update README to emphasize curated recipes over learning

title: Idempotency support
description: REST: Idempotency-Key header on task-creating endpoints. MCP: idempotency_key field on run/run_browser_agent/run_deep_research. Same key + same input within TTL returns original task_id. Keys redacted like secrets.

title: Make SkillStore writes atomic and concurrency-safe
Implement fingerprint module (recipes/fingerprint.py)
description: Typed JSON path sets + Jaccard similarity >= 0.85 (depth 6). Pure functions + golden tests. Used for recipe quality state machine transitions.

title: Fix sensitive header stripping to use substring matching
description: Oracle warning: Current exact-match stripping misses headers like x-algolia-api-key. Change to substring/pattern matching (any header containing 'auth', 'token', 'cookie', 'api-key', 'csrf') plus allowlist override for public keys.

title: Add Claude Code plugin structure
close_reason: Fixed in commits f3eeb19, faa3f10, e6cc929, 805ecd6

title: [Phase 4] Social Media Skills
description: Create 25 social skills: YouTube (video-search, playlist-info, channel-info), Reddit (subreddit-posts), Hacker News (top-posts), Mastodon (trending). Easy/medium. Document hard skills (TikTok, Instagram, LinkedIn) for future.

title: [Phase 2] Cloud Pricing Skills
description: Create 15 cloud pricing skills: PaaS (Vercel, Netlify, Railway, Render, Fly.io), Databases (MongoDB Atlas, PlanetScale, Neon), Auth/Tools (Clerk, Cloudflare, Sentry). All easy difficulty, public pricing pages.

title: [Phase 3] E-Commerce Skills
description: Create 20 e-commerce skills: Slickdeals (hot-deals), eBay (product-search), RockAuto, Yandex Market. Medium difficulty. Document Amazon limitations (CAPTCHA). Skip hard anti-bot sites initially.

title: Implement verifier (recipes/verifier.py)
description: Replay + shape fingerprint + promotion rules. Checks fingerprint consistency (Jaccard >= 0.85). Manages quality state machine: draft -> verified -> deprecated. Self-healing.

title: Add extract transforms (strip_quotes, url_decode, trim)
description: Tokens often need normalization. Add transform field to extract step: strip_quotes, url_decode, trim, regex_extract. Prevents one-off hacks in recipes.

title: Pooled HTTP clients + session reuse
description: Add pooled httpx clients for httpx_public transport. Per-session APIRequestContext reuse for context_request. Reduces connection overhead on repeated recipe execution.

title: Phase 0: Fix transport/install defaults inconsistency
description: Current state is broken: config.py defaults to stdio, but server.py deprecates it and exits. fastmcp.json says stdio. cli.py install() writes stdio config. STDIO_DEPRECATION_MESSAGE shows wrong port (8000 vs 8383). Fix: 1) Change ServerSettings.transport default to streamable-http in config.py, 2) Update fastmcp.json transport, 3) Fix cli.py install() to write HTTP-based config, 4) Fix hard-coded port in deprecation message. Validation: new user can follow one documented path and connect without hitting stdio deprecation.

title: Phase 1: Daemon keep-alive and health checks
description: Adopt claude-mem reliability pattern: multi-layer health checks (PID exists + process alive + HTTP responds). Options: 1) Add supervisor.py module with spawn_server_process(), kill_process_tree(), monitor_loop() for crash recovery and proper Windows process tree cleanup, 2) Expose true HTTP /health endpoint (not just MCP tool) returning status/uptime/version/transport/running_tasks, 3) Enhance status command to check all three layers. Validation: if worker dies unexpectedly, it recovers without manual intervention (if supervised); status reflects true health.

title: Phase 2: Add minimal web viewer
description: Add claude-mem style web viewer served by the daemon. Minimal scope: static HTML+JS (no React/bundling), served from package resources. Endpoints: GET / (viewer HTML), GET /api/tasks, GET /api/tasks/{id}, POST /api/tasks/{id}/cancel, GET /stream (SSE). SSE events: task_created, task_updated, task_completed. Security: localhost-only by default, require auth_token for non-localhost. No sensitive data exposure (use existing header redaction patterns). Files: viewer/assets/viewer.html, viewer/routes.py, observability/api.py facade.

title: Add doctor command for setup validation
description: Add 'mcp-server-browser-use doctor' command that checks: API key availability, Playwright browser availability, config readability, port availability, filesystem writability for state/log dirs. Provides actionable error messages. Optionally add 'setup' command that runs Playwright install and writes baseline config.

title: Phase 3: Decide CLI-first vs Hybrid vs Web-first UX
description: Decision point after Phase 2: A) CLI-first (minimal viewer, lowest maintenance), B) Hybrid (CLI for lifecycle/config, viewer for monitoring/control - recommended, mirrors claude-mem), C) Web-first (CLI only start/stop, viewer dominant with config editing - highest complexity). Affects: what features to build, security/auth hardening scope, API stability commitments. Recommendation: Option B (Hybrid).

title: [Phase 2] Developer Skills - GitHub, npm, PyPI
description: Create 30 developer tool skills: GitHub (repo-search, user-repos, user-profile, repo-contributors, actions-pricing), npm (package-search, package-info, package-downloads), PyPI (package-search, package-info, package-releases), Docker Hub, Hugging Face. All easy difficulty, no auth.

title: Add concurrent task tracking tests
description:
Add tests for concurrent agent execution:

1. Multiple tasks running simultaneously
   - Each task gets unique task_id
   - Task store correctly tracks all tasks
   - No cross-contamination of results

2. Task status isolation  
   - Canceling one task doesn't affect others
   - Failed task doesn't corrupt others' state
   - Progress updates isolated per task

3. Logging isolation
   - Each task logs to correct context
   - No interleaved log entries

4. Results storage
   - Results saved to correct files when results_dir configured
   - No overwriting between concurrent tasks

Test cases:
- test_concurrent_browser_agents
- test_concurrent_task_cancellation  
- test_concurrent_results_isolation
- test_concurrent_progress_tracking

title: Plugin Architecture Migration
description: Migrate mcp-browser-use from standalone MCP server to Claude Code plugin with auto-install, persistent daemon, and bundled web UI. Decisions: (1) Daemon runs persistently, hooks check/start if needed, (2) stdio MCP wrapper  HTTP daemon pattern, (3) smart-install.py for Playwright auto-setup, (4) Web UI bundled in plugin.

title: Create plugin directory structure
description: Create .claude-plugin/, hooks/, scripts/, skills/, ui/ directories. Add plugin.json manifest with name, version, description, author, repository, license, keywords. Add marketplace.json for distribution.
close_reason: Created plugin structure: .claude-plugin/, hooks/, scripts/, skills/, ui/ with plugin.json and marketplace.json

title: Create stdio MCP wrapper that forwards to HTTP daemon
description: Create scripts/mcp-server.py - a stdio-based MCP server that forwards all tool calls to the HTTP daemon at localhost:8383. This follows claude-mem's pattern where the MCP server is lightweight and the daemon does the heavy lifting. The wrapper handles JSON-RPC over stdin/stdout.
close_reason: Created scripts/mcp-server.py - stdio wrapper forwarding 11 tools to HTTP daemon

title: Create smart-install.py for first-time setup
description: Create scripts/smart-install.py that runs on SessionStart hook. Checks: (1) Python/uv available, (2) Playwright browsers installed - if not, runs 'playwright install chromium', (3) Config directory exists, (4) Default config created if missing. Should be idempotent and fast on subsequent runs.
close_reason: Created scripts/smart-install.py - checks Playwright and config, auto-installs if needed

title: Create daemon-check hook for SessionStart
description: Create scripts/daemon-check.py and hooks/hooks.json. On SessionStart: check if HTTP daemon is running (health check to localhost:8383/health), if not running start it in background. Daemon should be persistent (survives Claude Code restart). Use PID file for tracking. Return hookSpecificOutput with daemon status.
close_reason: Created scripts/daemon-check.py and hooks/hooks.json - ensures daemon running on SessionStart

title: Create .mcp.json with stdio server config
description: Create .mcp.json that registers the stdio MCP wrapper: {"browser-use": {"type": "stdio", "command": "${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/scripts/mcp-server.py"}}. This replaces manual MCP installation - plugin install auto-registers the MCP server.
close_reason: Created .mcp.json registering browser-use stdio server with PYTHONPATH

title: Bundle web viewer UI in plugin
description: Create ui/viewer.html and ui/viewer-bundle.js (or inline JS). Web UI served by HTTP daemon at localhost:8383. Shows: task list, task details, live status via SSE. Static HTML + vanilla JS (no build toolchain). Light/dark theme support. This is Phase 2 from beads-0003.
close_reason: Created ui/viewer.html with task list, details, health indicator, auto-refresh, dark mode. Added /api/* REST endpoints and / route to serve UI.

title: Create SKILL.md for browser-use skill
description: Create skills/browser-use/SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter and documentation. Describes available MCP tools (run_browser_agent, run_deep_research, skill_list/get/delete, health_check, task_list/get/cancel). Includes usage examples, parameter documentation, common workflows.
close_reason: Created skills/browser-use/SKILL.md - documented 9 tools with examples and workflows

title: Publish to marketplace
description: Create GitHub release with plugin files. Update marketplace.json with version and source. Document installation: '/plugin marketplace add igortarasenko/mcp-browser-use' then '/plugin install mcp-browser-use'. Test full install flow from scratch.

title: Fix parameter passing in recipe learning
description: Wrong query terms in some cases. v1: parameterize only obvious search params (q, query, term, search, page, limit), leave rest constant.

title: Align skills docs with CLI guidance
[Phase 1] Extend Skill Model with Categorization
description: Add to Skill dataclass: SkillAuth (for API-key skills), category/subcategory/tags fields, difficulty classification, rate_limit_delay_ms + last_executed_at tracking, max_response_size_bytes. Update YAML serialization in store.py.
close_reason: Added SkillAuth dataclass, category/subcategory/tags, difficulty, rate_limit_delay_ms, last_executed_at, max_response_size_bytes. Updated to_dict/from_dict with 4 new tests.

title: Epic: Phase 3 - Recipe Library Scale-Up
description: 20+ verified recipes across 4+ categories. Batch learning, replay verification, dual-source registry, SkillAuth model, rate limit handling.

title: Unify sensitive header handling in skills
Add skills.enabled config flag (default: false for beta)
description:
Add config flag to enable/disable skills module:

```python
class SkillsSettings(BaseSettings):
    enabled: bool = False  # Beta - disabled by default
    directory: str | None = None
```

When disabled:
- skill_* tools not registered
- run_browser_agent ignores skill_name parameter
- No skill learning even with learn=True

This allows stable use of agent and deep_research while skills mature.

Config example:
```json
{
  "skills": {
    "enabled": true,
    "directory": "~/.config/browser-skills"
  }
}
```
close_reason: Implemented skills.enabled config flag with default=False. When disabled: skill_* tools not registered, skill_name/learn params ignored in run_browser_agent, skill components not initialized.

title: [Phase 2] Financial Data Skills
description: Create 20 financial skills: CoinGecko (coin-price, coin-info, trending), Yahoo Finance (stock-quote, stock-info), Polymarket (trending-markets), XE (exchange-rate). Easy/medium difficulty, mostly public APIs.

title: Version reporting + OpenAPI
description: /api/version endpoint. health_check includes version + git sha. REST OpenAPI at /api/openapi.json pinned in CI. Generated typed REST client for dashboard + contract tests.

title: [Phase 1] Implement Batch Skill Learner
description: Create SkillBatchLearner class with learn_all() using example_params from manifest. Features: filtering by category/difficulty/auth, delay between skills, resume capability, metadata stamping, response fixture saving. Add CLI command: mcp-server-browser-use skills learn-batch

title: [Phase 1] Add Skill Registry (Dual-Source Architecture)
description: Create SkillLibrary (read-only shipped skills from package) and SkillRegistry (unified query interface). User skills shadow library skills. Add skill_search and skill_categories MCP tools using registry.

title: GitHub Actions CI pipeline
description: Lint, typecheck, unit+integration on PRs. Move initial CI setup from Phase 4 to Phase 2 timeline.

title: Fix URL encoding mismatch in direct skill fetch
close_reason: Fixed URL encoding inconsistency by using request.build_url() consistently

title: Implement artifacts models (recipes/artifacts/models.py)
description: Pydantic models for all stage artifacts. SessionRecording, SignalSet, CandidateSet, AnalysisResult, ValidationResult, BaselineFingerprint, MinimizationResult, VerificationReport. Each includes schema_hash.

title: Implement draft-first recipe fallback in analyzer
description: Oracle recommendation: When LLM analysis fails (success=false or malformed JSON), build draft recipe directly from recording instead of returning None. Steps: 1) Filter calls: status==200 + mime_type contains json, 2) Score: prefer XHR/Fetch, URLs with task keywords, larger body, 3) Build RecipeRequest with auto-templated query params, 4) Set status='draft'. This single change jumps auto-saved artifacts from 20% to almost always.
close_reason: Wrong approach - recipes should be procedural knowledge, not draft templates

title: Capture non-JSON API responses in recorder
Implement pipeline orchestrator (recipes/pipeline.py)
description: Orchestrates 8 stages: record -> signals -> candidates -> analyze -> validate -> baseline -> minimize -> verify. Emits artifacts per stage. Supports resume via artifact schema_hash.

title: Fix remaining test failures
description: Dashboard 404s (route registration order), tool count mismatch (expects 9, has 10), SSE endpoint tests.

title: Extract skill_learn tool from run_browser_agent
description:
Create a dedicated `skill_learn` MCP tool for skill extraction:

```python
@server.tool()
async def skill_learn(
    task: str,
    max_steps: int = 15,
) -> str:
    """Run browser agent in learning mode to extract a reusable skill.
    
    Returns the learned skill YAML on success.
    """
```

Currently embedded in run_browser_agent with `learn=True` parameter.

This separates concerns:
- run_browser_agent: Execute tasks (optionally with skill hints)
- skill_learn: Dedicated skill extraction workflow
- skill_run: Direct skill execution
